alert.note: Alert for Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades; South Central Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 28 at 1:45PM PST until December 30 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 PM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations 14 to 24 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 to 50 mph. * WHERE...South Oregon Cascades from Howard Prairie northward. This includes Diamond and Crater Lake, Willamette Pass and Lake of the Woods as well as portions of highways 140, 62, 138, 58 and 230. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 4 PM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The advisory spans a lengthy period due to multiple impulses expected pass through with very little break in between. The heaviest snow is expected early Thursday morning, then again Thursday evening into Friday morning. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades; South Central Oregon Cascades
